title: Crime Scene:  Pakistan
content: Fragment of breakfast conversation, over waffles (abbreviating from memory)...Kirby: there're these giant engines out there that do nothing but look up domain names all day, called DNS servers.  You give 'em a domain (like google.com) and they hand you back a number (like 192.168...).Dawn:  sounds more intelligent than missile guidance systems.Tara:  yeah, missiles don't have to do as much.Kirby:  Yep.  Although it's a missile making the headlines today [see Oregonian].  It's out and out murder of course, and whoever did it should go to jail for life, but they hide behind the CIA, saying "the CIA did it" (sarcastic voice, impersonating a dumb-ass).Dawn and Tara:  [laughter]
author: Kirby Urner
